Do you want the number of sundays, or the number of not-sundays?

<@U0N4RS70W>:  Don't you still need to bind your view to your presenter in some way? For example you should have something like `return new ContactListPresenter(mView);`
well that’s what i do at the first time, the thing is i would not use @Inject for mView then, and also how to proceed with requestManager ?
Since you are using Dagger 2, the debugger should be quite helpful in seeing what has not been initialized
You still need to do the actual injection with your component
sorry what do you mean ?
you should do something like `PresenterContactlistComponent.inject(yourPresenterHere)`
already done that on my fragment

```PresenterContactListComponent presenter = DaggerPresenterContactListComponent.builder()
                .apiModule(new ApiModule())
                .contactListPresenterModule(new ContactListPresenterModule(this))
                .build();
        presenter.inject(this)```
when debuggin the problem i find is ```providesContactListFragment()``` is never called
Do you have in your Fragment a field like:

`@Inject`
 `protected ContactListPresenter presenter;`

i do ```@Inject
    protected ContactListPresenter mContactListPresenter;```
in fact the presenter is being generated and the method ```public ContactListPresenter providesContactListPresenter() ``` is called
what is not being injected are the fields inside the presenter
sorry I read wrong
So if I understand correctly, your presenter holds the view and the api and none of them is initialized
exactly
I suppose you are not doing constructor injection in your presenter but field injection
i’m doing field injection exactly
is it wrong ?
Do contructor injection for the presenter
but the constructor will have as field the RequestManager ?
yes
i do have a field called mView in the module, but no for the RequestManager, since it is in another module
passing the requestManager in the constructor looks terrible also
since you do this `@Component(modules = {ContactListPresenterModule.class, ApiModule.class})`
then it should work, it will resolve both the view and the requestManager from the other two modules
But if I'm honest with you, you probably don't want to pass the view in the contrustor at all. You should bind and unbind from it on demand
so `public void bindView(ContactListFragment view)` and `public void unbindView(ContactListFragment view)`
oh so if i do constructor injection i dont need ```providesContactListPresenter``` didn’t know that, that was the trick
yes will use bind, thanks, i was just migrating an old project to use dagger2, just for getting use to it
No you should need the provides method still
mmmm i took it out and it’s working fine
how to fetch lyrics and load it ?
any guide ?
<@U0J3AKMPS>: you need to find an API that can provide you with such lyrics as a first step
<https://www.publicapis.com/search?keyword=lyrics>

text: <@U0N4RS70W> have you fixed your issue? i think your injected fields have to be public or at least package local, you’ve got them protected.

you should be able to inject on field though.
mm not sure why wasn’t working, but don’t think is a protected issue, since the injection for the presenter is as protected and working fine

yes thanks !
